page.title: 06LIFE IN OLDHAM- 1945/1985
page.content: Life in Oldham was hard.Children left school when they were twelve and went to work in the cotton mills.The work was done by hand as there were no machines. People lived in terraced houses. there were no flats or housing estates. Inside they had gas. The shops were small and people went to the markets,there were no supermarkets.There were hat, herb, paper and pawn shops. People had little spare time because they worked longer hours.For entertainment they went to the cinema or listened to radios,there was no television. People travelled by tramcars or by foot,the rich travelled by cars. Life in 1985 is a lot better than it was in 1945!The homes are bigger and children stay at school until 16. The cotton mills have now all gone.
